page.title: 11 SWIFTS HILL
page.content: { Map Ref:_ 877067 { Swifts Hill is called Elliott Hill by the Gloucestershiire Nature Trust who own it. It covers about{23.7}acres .Foxes and Badgers cross the reserve. Also it is frequented by Kestrels and Green Woodpeckers .Adders and Common Lizards have been recorded. There is also controlled grazing,by dairy cattle in summer.It is hoped to install cattlegrids and a water trough in the near future to secure control of stock.Grasshoppers and allied insects are very abundant and all the species typical of limestone grassland are present;{29}butterfly and{22 mollusc species . The{4}flowers on Swifts Hill we saw were Cowslips,Daisies,Buttercups and the rare Early Purple Orchid.
